vague_description: The task involves determining the optimal number of glass and plastic jars to use for selling a fixed quantity of honey while adhering to certain constraints on jar types.
detailed_description: A honey farmer sells his honey in glass and plastic jars. A glass jar can hold \var{VolGlass} ml of honey while a plastic jar can hold \var{VolPlastic} ml of honey. Since glass jars are more expensive, at least \var{MinRatio} times as many plastic jars must be filled as glass jars. However, at least \var{MinGlass} glass jars should be filled. If the farmer has \var{TotalHoney} ml of honey, how many jars of each should be filled to maximize the total number of bottles filled?
target_objective: Maximize the total number of bottles filled
target_constraints: Number of glass jars is an integer
Number of plastic jars is an integer
Number of glass jars is non-negative
Number of plastic jars is non-negative
Volume of honey in glass jars per jar is VolGlass
Volume of honey in plastic jars per jar is VolPlastic
At least MinRatio times as many plastic jars must be filled as glass jars
At least MinGlass glass jars should be filled
Total volume of honey filled cannot exceed TotalHoney
target_parameters: Volume of honey a glass jar can hold
Volume of honey a plastic jar can hold
Minimum ratio of plastic jars to glass jars to be filled
Minimum number of glass jars to be filled
